Just for the record, and for the benefit of the group, isn't the "r
(x) met=
hod" just a mechanism employed within the current 
infrastructure limitatio=
ns, to map multiple agents within the 
substraite and generalize the CPPN t=
o the presence of the multiple 
agents?

ias Fagerlund" <mattias@...> wrote:
>
> Ken, let me clear up that I'm prett=
y certain that the r(x) method 
will

hod I mentioned (supplying

 evaluated). The 
reason I

ere's a trivial 
method of
> assigning roles that's more powerful than the =
r(x) method.

se it is a

a

c=
ontrast,

on 
the

value.
